data.title: « STRI-ANGLE »
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

s = input()

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

def Striangle(s):
    for i in range(len(s)):
        print(s[i:])

Striangle(s)

'''This is the shortest code I can come up with:

s=input()
for i in range(len(s)):print(s[i:])
'''
data.statement:
You awake to find yourself in a cold, dim-lighted office. Looking at the clock, you realise it's 11:44 at night... all your fellow employees have already left. You try to get up, but realise that you're handcuffed to your chair. There's a note at your desk, just beside your laptop, with your boss's scrawly handwriting clearly discernible by the light of a desk-lamp.

(Here's the Note:)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————————
You were given a simple assignment... but you were too busy chatting on the Community Forum to notice that everyone else had completed their assignments more than 6 hours ago.

You've got until 12 o'clock midnight to create a solution to this simple problem:

Given a string, [[s]], you must print each character of [[s]] to make a triangle... or a "stri-angle" in this format:
```
<<TEXT
EXT
XT
T>>
```
(P.S. Your solution must be shorter than everyone else's solutions, otherwise you're fired!)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————————

With a long sigh, you glance at the clock... it's 11:45. Okay, you've got 15 minutes.

You start to type the first lines of your program... but how are you going to do this?

testCases.testOut:
STRING
TRING
RING
ING
NG
G

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testOut:
TAC/ACT/CAT/
AC/ACT/CAT/
C/ACT/CAT/
/ACT/CAT/
ACT/CAT/
CT/CAT/
T/CAT/
/CAT/
CAT/
AT/
T/
/

data.constraints:
0 < length of [[s]] < 50

[[s]] contains alpha-numeric, white-space and symbolic characters.
data.stubGenerator:
read s:string(50)

write answer
nswer
swer
wer
er
r
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string, [[s]], that you must make a "stri-angle" out of.
data.outputDescription: <<[[?]] Lines:>> Characters from [[s]] to form a triangle.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You awake to find yourself in a cold, dim-lighted office. Looking at the clock, you realise it's 11:44 at night... all your fellow employees have already left. You try to get up, but realise that you're handcuffed to your chair. There's a note at your desk, just beside your laptop, with your boss's scrawly handwriting clearly discernible by the light of a desk-lamp.

(Here's the Note:)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————————
You were given a simple assignment... but you were too busy chatting on the Community Forum to notice that everyone else had completed their assignments more than 6 hours ago.

You've got until 12 o'clock midnight to create a solution to this simple problem:

Given a string, s, you must print each character of s to make a triangle... or a "stri-angle" in this format:

TEXT
EXT
XT
T

(P.S. Your solution must be shorter than everyone else's solutions, otherwise you're fired!)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————————

With a long sigh, you glance at the clock... it's 11:45. Okay, you've got 15 minutes.

You start to type the first lines of your program... but how are you going to do this?




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A string, s, that you must make a "stri-angle" out of.

   

   

      
Output

      
? Lines: Characters from s to form a triangle.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 < length of s < 50

s contains alpha-numeric, white-space and symbolic characters.

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
STRING

         

         

            
Output

            
STRING
TRING
RING
ING
NG
G
